Add Brand Logo to ggplot2 Plot

Source: R/ggplot2.R
brand_add_logo.Rd

Adds a logo from the brand configuration as an annotation to a ggplot2 plot.

Usage

brand_add_logo(x = 0.9, y = 0.1, size = 0.05, logo_type = "icon")

Arguments

x

Numeric. Horizontal position of the logo (0-1 scale). Default is 0.9.

y

Numeric. Vertical position of the logo (0-1 scale). Default is 0.1.

size

Numeric. Size of the logo as a fraction of the plot (0-1 scale). Default is 0.05.

logo_type

Character. Which logo to use: "icon" (default) or "full".

Value

A ggplot2 annotation_custom layer that can be added to a plot with +.

Details

This function reads the logo path from the stored brand configuration and creates a ggplot2 annotation layer. The brand configuration must be loaded first using brand_set_ggplot().

The function supports PNG images and requires the 'png' and 'grid' packages.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# First set the brand theme to load configuration
brand_set_ggplot()

# Create a plot and add logo
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = wt)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = "Example Plot") +
  brand_add_logo()

# Customize logo position and size
ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = wt)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = "Example Plot") +
  brand_add_logo(x = 0.1, y = 0.9, size = 0.08)
} # }
